TopReViews.Title: 1st time (yup, no grilled meat, yet)
TopReViews.Comment:
FOOD: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
The seasoning was pretty authentic, only the spice level was adjusted to Vietnamese taste.
Naengmyeon (cold noodle): The noodles was chewy in a bouncy kind of way. The sauce was light, a little bit spicy and very refreshing. I like this dish the most.
Jajjangmyeon (black bean sauce noodle): It was not the authentic type of noodles, which made the dish a little off because the texture of the noodles is one of the most factors of this dish. It was supposed to be the round, thick and chewy noodles. Anyway, the dish was OK. 
Kimbap (rolls): The seafood wrapped was good, pretty basic. The mango wrapped was interesting.
Tobokkie (spicy rice cake): The sauce was adjusted to Vietnamese taste, not as spicy and pretty sweet.
Bibimbap (mixed rice): Perfect to end your meal.
Banchan (side dishes): Kimchi was freshly made. The rest was pretty tasty.

SPACE: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ
Spacious.
Give off Korean restaurant vibe.
Cozy.

SERVICE: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ

PRICE: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ‚òÜ
Worth it (kind of). 
It was my friend birthday so she took care of the bills.
